content.title: Atherosclerotic Renal Artery Stenosis Treatment
content.definition: Management of renal artery stenosis due to atherosclerosis, encompassing medical optimization versus revascularization strategies based on clinical presentation and evidence.

current_evidence.astral_trial: No benefit of revascularization over medical therapy for mild-moderate RAS
current_evidence.coral_trial: No benefit for blood pressure or renal function with stenting
current_evidence.conclusion: Medical therapy is first-line for most patients

medical_therapy.monitoring: Creatinine, potassium monitoring with ACE/ARB initiation

not_supported: Mild hypertension controlled on medical therapy
